DOC.brief_summary: The propose of this study is to assess the effect of general practitioner's involvement on first patients' solicitation in screening for colorectal cancer by testing for faecal occult blood (FOBT).
DOC.brief_title: Does the Invitation by the General Practitioner Improve Patients' Participation in Colorectal Cancer Screening?
DOC.criteria: Aged : 50 to 74 years. Not having ever been invited to participate in colorectal screening. Patients who have a Fecal Occult Blood Test for less than 2 years or a colonoscopy within the past 5 years or excluded for medical reasons (according to information known from ADECA).
